name: Giftcard Reward
description: Automate the email of gift cards to eligible recipients

versions.1.0.4: Add token to batch processing needed for Framework 8
versions.1.1.0: Ability to inhibit emails and customize gift card display
versions.3.0.0: Change to use DB Internal Lock/Release functions.  Added additional messages when gift cards cannot be reserved
versions.3.2.0: Added additional customization of giftcard display and emails

crons.cron_description: This cron will run once a day to send project owners a summary of their gift card dispersements
This cron will run once a day at 9am to check for gift card logic statuses which are based on a date.

system-settings.name:
Enable Debug Logging
If you have the Stanford emLogger external module installed and configured, you can enable additional debug-level logging through this checkbox

project-settings.name:
GCR Project ID
This is the project containing all of the gift cards

GCR Event ID
If the Gift Card Repository is longitudinal, specify the numerical Event ID where the form resides
Leave blank for classical. Must be a number

Alert Email
In the event gift cards are exhausted or any other error occurs, an email will be sent to this email address

CC Email
This email address will be cc'd on all verification emails sent to participants when they become eligible for a reward, when the option is selected. Also, this email will be sent a copy of each Rewards email, when the option is selected. Each configuration has an option for verification and rewards emails so you can pick and choose based on the specific reward

Styling for Reward Display Pages
The following options allow you to customize the reward display page. The page will default to the following settings if no values are entered below:
  • Header & Footer color (default: #FFFFFF or white)
  • Logo (no image)
  • Background (no image)
  • Table Background Color (default #DAD7CB)

Gift Card Reward Header And Footer Color
(enter hex value or color name such as #0000FF or blue)

Gift Card Reward Logo
(enter URL of image to display)

Gift Card Reward Background Image
(enter URL of image to display)

Gift Card Reward Table Color
(enter hex value or color name such as #0000FF or blue)

Gift Card Instance
Each of the fields below configure a single gift card event from this project.

sub_settings.name:
Reward Settings
The following fields are used to determine when a participant is eligible for an award and how to handle the notification.

Reward Title
A descriptive name for this reward
(e.g. Baseline Complete)

Reward Event ID
Specify the event in this project where the the fields defined below are located. Note that this cannot be a repeating event

Reward Logic
A gift card will be automatically awarded when this logic is true AND the 'Reward ID' field below is empty

Reward ID Field
Specify a field in this project where the ID of the Gift Card assigned to this reward will be stored

Reward ID Status Field
Specify the field in this project where the reward status should be stored

Reward ID URL field
This url is normally sent in an email from the GCR project, but you can also store it in this project. This can be useful if you wish to display the url to a participant and bypass email (see Link Only / No email section below).
* Optional unless you use the Link Only/No Email setting

Reward Number field
The actual gift card number is normally displayed from the reward-url, but in some cases you might want to bring it into this project so you can show it to the user. WARNING: If you display the reward from this project without using the reward-url, the status of the reward by not be known. You cannot determine if someone 'viewed' it or if it has just be 'reserved'. So, this is not recommended for most use cases.
* Optional unless you use the Link Only/No Email setting

Reward Amount
Specify the dollar amount (number only) for this gift card (ex. 20 for twenty dollars).
Only cards with a matching dollar amount from the GCR will be used.
If left blank, the next card from the GCR will be taken regardless of dollar value

Brand
Select the field that holds the brand that will be used for filtering gift cards. If empty, brand filtering is not performed. The brand field must be defined as a dropdown or radio in this project with a value that matches the name of the brand in the GCR

Link Only / No Email
When this option checkbox is selected, gift card processing will not send the gift card link to an email address. Instead, it will only reserve a gift card from the library. When you check this, you should be sure to return the reward url+hash to this project and then display it to the participant (via piping or via an alert/notification). This is designed for cases where you do not capture the participants email in your project. This does mean, however, that it is easier for someone to potentially retake the survey again and get another code

Reward Email Address
Enter the email address field from this project where the reward will be sent. This field does not need to be in the same event as the other gift card fields but it cannot be on a repeating form or in a repeating event or in multiple events. This field is required to be filled in unless the 'Link Only / No emails' checkbox above is selected

Reward Email From
Enter the email address to use in the From field. This field does not need to be filled in when the 'Link Only / No emails' checkbox is selected

Verification Email Settings
The following fields are used to tailor the subject and body of the verification email that contains a link+hash which will open a page where they can view the reward.

Reward Notification Email Subject
Enter the subject for the reward notification email. This is the email that is sent to a participant when they become eligible for a reward. The gift card is not included in this email, instead, a link to the gift card display is included in this email.
Piping is allowed

Reward Notification Email Body
Enter text to appear before the link to the reward in the body of the email.
Piping is allowed.

CC Reward Email
Check this box if you want each reward notification email to be cc'd to the CC Email address entered above.

Reward Display and Email Settings
The following fields are used to tailor the page where the reward is displayed AND for emails containing the actual award that might be triggered by entering an email on the Reward Display page. This content can be further customized by editing the language (English.ini) file on the server as it supports MLM.

Reward Code Email Subject
Enter the subject for the reward email when a participant would like a copy of the reward code.
Piping is allowed

Reward Code Header
Enter text to appear before the details of the reward in the body of the email and on the reward display page.
Piping is allowed.

CC Reward Email
Check this box if you want each reward email to be cc'd to the CC Reward Email address entered above.

Reward Display Override
Check this box if you want to override the default rendering of the gift/reward card. If set, this will apply to both email and webpage
(* Optional)

Reward Display Override Template
This field was added as a custom request for a project where they wanted more control over the display of the reward to a recipient when they click through on the reward url+hash link.
Enter the HTML you wish here and mask reward variables as follows: {{REWARD_NAME}}, {{REWARD_CODE}}, {{CHALLENGE_CODE}}, {{BRAND}}, {{AMOUNT}}. This only applies if the 'Reward Display Override' checkbox above is checked

Batch Processing Options
You can configure batch-based processing so rewards are not automatically handed out in real-time

Batch Processing
Select this checkbox for batch processing. No gift cards will automatically be sent but a list is of eligible records will be provided from the EM Batch Processing page so you can select the records you want to send gift cards to. Do not select Batch Processing if 'Link Only / No emails' is selected.

Fields to Display for Batch Processing
Comma separately list of fields to display when selecting gift cards to send during batch processing. The fields must reside in this configuration event. This list is only used when 'Batch Processing' above is selected.

Notification Settings
The following are options to keep you informed about your gift card library. As a default, you will receive email notifications for these events:
  • There are no gifts available but a participant qualifies for one.
  • A daily summary describing the gift card library status.

Opt-Out Low Balance Notification
When Opt-Out Low Balance Notification is checked, email notifications will not be sent to the email address in the Alert Email field when the number of available rewards drops below the threshold number.

Low Balance Threshold
If a number is entered and the checkbox to Opt-Out Low Balance Notifications is not selected, an email will be sent to the Alert Email address when the number of available rewards falls below this number. When left empty, emails will only be sent when a participant is eligible but there are none to send.

Opt-Out Daily Summary
When Opt-Out Daily Summary is checked, the daily report will not be sent to the Alert Email which details the daily activity for the gift card processing project.

Allow Multiple Rewards
Normally, when this is NOT checked AND when an email field is mapped, only one reward will be issued per email address. If you wish to allow the same email to receive more than one award, then check this

Limit Rewards to One/Title/Email
This is a feature in progress and has not been implemented fully. If you need this, please post a request to the github site for the module. Currently, it does not function

Enable 9am cron job to check logic
When checked, this option allows for the 9am cron job to check the gift card reward logic to see if it is true. If true, a giftcard will be dispersed to the participant - same as when a participant record is saved. When left unchecked, the gift card logic check is only performed when the record is saved.
